com.vmware.cis

Interface Tasks

  • All Superinterfaces:
    com.vmware.vapi.internal.bindings.CompletionStageService, com.vmware.vapi.bindings.Service, TasksTypes
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    TasksStub

    public interface Tasks
extends com.vmware.vapi.bindings.Service, TasksTypes, com.vmware.vapi.internal.bindings.CompletionStageService
    The Tasks interface provides methods for managing the task related to a long running operation. This interface was added in vSphere API 6.7.1.

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Interface and Description
      static interface  Tasks.CancelInvocation
      Invocable that represents the Tasks#cancel vAPI operation.
      static interface  Tasks.GetInvocation
      Invocable that represents the Tasks#get vAPI operation.
      static interface  Tasks.ListInvocation
      Invocable that represents the Tasks#list vAPI operation.

      • Nested classes/interfaces inherited from interface com.vmware.cis.TasksTypes

        TasksTypes.FilterSpec, TasksTypes.GetSpec

    • Field Summary

      • Fields inherited from interface com.vmware.cis.TasksTypes

        _VAPI_SERVICE_ID, RESOURCE_TYPE

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      Tasks.CancelInvocation cancel(java.lang.String task)
      Cancel a running operation associated with the task.
      Tasks.GetInvocation get(java.lang.String task)
      Returns information about a task.
      Tasks.ListInvocation list()
      Returns information about at most 1000 visible (subject to permission checks) tasks matching the TasksTypes.FilterSpec.

    • Method Detail

      • get

        Tasks.GetInvocation get(java.lang.String task)
        Returns information about a task. This method was added in vSphere API 6.7.1.

        Invocation Result:
        Information about the specified task.

        Parameters:
        task - Task identifier. The parameter must be an identifier for the resource type: com.vmware.cis.task.
        Returns:
        instance of Tasks.GetInvocation which upon invoke executes the above described get operation. The operation result or the operation error will be stored in the CompletionStageFuture that invoke returns.
        Throws:
        Error - if the system reports an error while responding to the request.
        NotFound - if the task is not found.
        ResourceInaccessible - if the task's state cannot be accessed.
        ServiceUnavailable - if the system is unable to communicate with a service to complete the request.
        Unauthenticated - if the user can not be authenticated.
        Unauthorized - if the user doesn't have the required privileges.

      • list

        Tasks.ListInvocation list()
        Returns information about at most 1000 visible (subject to permission checks) tasks matching the TasksTypes.FilterSpec. All tasks must be in the same provider. This method was added in vSphere API 6.7.1.

        Invocation Result:
        Map of task identifier to information about the task. The key in the return value Map will be an identifier for the resource type: com.vmware.cis.task.

        Returns:
        instance of Tasks.ListInvocation which upon invoke executes the above described list operation. The operation result or the operation error will be stored in the CompletionStageFuture that invoke returns.
        Throws:
        InvalidArgument - if any of the specified parameters are invalid.
        ResourceInaccessible - if a task's state cannot be accessed or over 1000 tasks matching the TasksTypes.FilterSpec.
        ServiceUnavailable - if the system is unable to communicate with a service to complete the request.
        Unauthenticated - if the user can not be authenticated.
        Unauthorized - if the user doesn't have the required privileges.

      • cancel

        Tasks.CancelInvocation cancel(java.lang.String task)
        Cancel a running operation associated with the task. This is the best effort attempt. Operation may not be cancelled anymore once it reaches certain stage. This method was added in vSphere API 6.7.1.
        Parameters:
        task - Task identifier. The parameter must be an identifier for the resource type: com.vmware.cis.task.
        Returns:
        instance of Tasks.CancelInvocation which upon invoke executes the above described cancel operation. The operation result or the operation error will be stored in the CompletionStageFuture that invoke returns.
        Throws:
        Error - if the system reports an error while responding to the request.
        NotAllowedInCurrentState - if the task is already canceled or completed.
        NotFound - if the task is not found.
        ResourceInaccessible - if the task's state cannot be accessed.
        ServiceUnavailable - if the system is unable to communicate with a service to complete the request.
        Unauthenticated - if the user can not be authenticated.
        Unauthorized - if the user doesn't have the required privileges.
        Unsupported - if the task is not cancelable.
